availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Ohio
Scioto County
City of Portsmouth

Personally appeared before a me a Notary Public duly commissioned & sworn living in city, county, & state aforesaid Thos Dugan who made solemn oath to support the Constitution of the United States and well and truly perform & execute all the duties of Commissioner of the Commonwealth of Kentucky to take the acknowledgement of Deeds and other instruments of writing pertaining to said office in the State of Ohio

Sworn to and subscribed before me at Portsmouth O this the 16th day of March 1861
Thos Spencer
Notary Public

Oath of Thos Dugan
Comr of Deeds
Filed Mar 19. 1861
